docs.lead_paragraph: Should you, or should you not, think it rather a presumptuous and impertinent things for ARTHUR GUERONNIERE of Paris, deputy from Cautal, to advise and call upon NICHOLAS of Russia to abdicate his throne? docs.lead_paragraph: A FASTIDIOUS EDITOR.--JOHN W. BOYD, Esq., formerly editor of the Chambersburg (Pa.) Repository and Whig, having been recommended for the Mayoralty of Hagerstown, declines the honor, for certain cogent reasons, which he states at length in the Hagerstown Chronicle.

headline.main: Our Public Servants--dirty Streets and the Cholera.

docs.lead_paragraph: The short-comings and over-reachings of our unruly misrulers have become so general, and so generally complained of, that even the public ear refuses longer to be shocked by them. The truth is, we "are as a people without hope!"

headline.main: CANADA.; The Elections--Test Questions and State of Parties--Fires in Toronto, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Province is now passing through the excitement of a General Election, the writs for which were issued immediately on the breaking up of the Parliament, three weeks ago, and are returnable by the 10th of August.
docs.snippet: The Province is now passing through the excitement of a General Election, the writs for which were issued immediately on the breaking up of the Parliament, three weeks ago, and are returnable by the 10th of August.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: As cholera has appeared again in this City, any addition to the present stock of knowledge concerning its prevention and cure, you will, I doubt not, cheerfully lend your columns to promulgate.
